__construct.name: __construct
__construct.short_desc: What do you expect this to do? It makes a new Client instance. Available client options are as following (all are optional):
__construct.long_desc:
```
array(
  'disableClones' => bool|string[], (disables cloning of class instances (for perfomance), affects update events - bool: true - disables all cloning)
  'disableEveryone' => bool, (disables the everyone and here mentions and replaces them with plaintext, defaults to true)
  'fetchAllMembers' => bool, (fetches all guild members, this should be avoided - necessary members get automatically fetched)
  'messageCache' => bool, (enables message cache, defaults to true)
  'messageCacheLifetime' => int, (invalidates messages in the store older than the specified duration)
  'messageSweepInterval' => int, (interval when the message cache gets invalidated (see messageCacheLifetime), defaults to messageCacheLifetime)
  'presenceCache' => bool, (enables presence cache, defaults to true)
  'minShardID' => int, (minimum shard ID to spawn - 0-indexed, if omitted, the client will determine the shards to spawn themself)
  'maxShardID' => int, (maximum shard ID to spawn - 0-indexed, if omitted, the client will determine the shards to spawn themself)
  'shardCount' => int, (shard count, if omitted, the client will determine the shards to spawn themself)
  'userSweepInterval' => int, (interval when the user cache gets invalidated (users sharing no mutual guilds get removed), defaults to 600)
  'http.ratelimitbucket.name' => string, (class name of the custom ratelimit bucket, has to implement the interface)
  'http.restTimeOffset' => int|float, (specifies how many seconds should be waited after one REST request before the next REST request should be done)
  'http.requestErrorDelay' => int, (specifies how many seconds should be waited after a HTTP 5XX error before queueing the request again, after two retries the time will be doubled, defaults to 30 - minimum 15)
  'http.requestMaxRetries' => int, (specifies how many times the request should be retried on HTTP 5XX until we give up, defaults to 0 (never give up))
  'ws.compression' => string, (Enables a specific one, defaults to zlib-stream, which is currently the only available compression)
  'ws.encoding' => string, (use a specific websocket encoding, JSON or ETF (if suggested package installed), recommended is JSON for now)
  'ws.disabledEvents' => string[], (disables specific websocket events (e.g. TYPING_START), only disable websocket events if you know what they do)
  'ws.largeThreshold' => int, (50-250, members threshold after which guilds gets counted as large, defaults to 250)
  'ws.presence' => array, (the presence to send on WS connect, see https://discordapp.com/developers/docs/topics/gateway#gateway-status-update)
  'ws.presenceUpdate.ignoreUnknownUsers' => bool, (whether we ignore presence updates of uncached users, defaults to false)
)
```

loop.name: loop
loop.short_desc: You can pass an event loop to the class, or it will automatically create one (you still need to make it run yourself).

addPeriodicTimer.name: addPeriodicTimer
addPeriodicTimer.short_desc: Adds a "client-dependant" periodic timer. The timer gets automatically cancelled on destroy. The callback can only accept one argument, the client.

addTimer.name: addTimer
addTimer.short_desc: Adds a "client-dependant" timer. The timer gets automatically cancelled on destroy. The callback can only accept one argument, the client.

createGuild.name: createGuild
createGuild.short_desc: Creates a new guild. Resolves with an instance of Guild. Options is as following, everything is optional unless specified:
createGuild.long_desc:
```
array(
  'name' => string, (required)
  'region' => \CharlotteDunois\Yasmin\Models\VoiceRegion|string, (required)
  'icon' => string, (an URL, a filepath or data)
  'verificationLevel' => int, (0-4)
  'defaultMessageNotifications' => int, (0 or 1)
  'explicitContentFilter' => int, (0-2)
  'roles' => array, (an array of role arrays*)
  'channels' => array (an array of channel arrays**)

    * array( // role array
    *   'name' => string, (required)
    *   'permissions' => \CharlotteDunois\Yasmin\Models\Permissions|int,
    *   'color' => int|string,
    *   'hoist' => bool,
    *   'mentionable' => bool
    * )

    ** array( // channel array
    **   'name' => string, (required)
    **   'type' => 'text'|'voice', (category is not supported by the API, defaults to 'text')
    **   'bitrate' => int, (only for voice channels)
    **   'userLimit' => int, (only for voice channels, 0 = unlimited)
    **   'permissionOverwrites' => array, (an array of permission overwrite arrays***)
    **   'nsfw' => bool (only for text channels)
    ** )

    *** array( // overwrite array, all required
    ***   'id' => \CharlotteDunois\Yasmin\Models\User|string, (string = user ID or role name (of above role array!))
    ***   'allow' => \CharlotteDunois\Yasmin\Models\Permissions|int,
    ***   'deny' => \CharlotteDunois\Yasmin\Models\Permissions|int
    *** )
)
```

CharlotteDunois\\Yasmin\\Interfaces\\Rat.name: CharlotteDunois\Yasmin\Interfaces\RatelimitBucketInterface
CharlotteDunois\\Yasmin\\Interfaces\\Rat.short_desc:
This interface defines required methods and their arguments for managing route ratelimits using various systems.
The ratelimit bucket queue is always managed in memory (as in belongs to that process), however the ratelimits are distributed to the used system.
CharlotteDunois\\Yasmin\\Interfaces\\Rat.long_desc:
Included are two ratelimit bucket systems:
* In memory ratelimit bucket, using arrays - Class: `\CharlotteDunois\Yasmin\HTTP\RatelimitBucket` (default)
* Redis ratelimit bucket, using Athena to interface with Redis - Class: `\CharlotteDunois\Yasmin\HTTP\AthenaRatelimitBucket` To use a different one than the default, you have to pass the full qualified class name to the client constructor as client option `http.ratelimitbucket.name`. The Redis ratelimit bucket system uses Athena, an asynchronous redis cache for PHP. The package is called `charlottedunois/athena` (which is suggested on composer).
To be able to use the Redis ratelimit bucket, you need to pass an instance of `AthenaCache` as client option `http.ratelimitbucket.athena` to the client.

getEndpoint.name: getEndpoint
getEndpoint.short_desc: Returns the endpoint this bucket is for.

getMeta.long_desc:

```
    'resetTime' => float|null
)
```

```
)
```

createChannel.long_desc:
Options are as following (all fields except name are optional):

```
array(
  'name' => string,
  'type' => 'category'|'text'|'voice', (defaults to 'text')
  'topic' => string, (only for text channels)
  'bitrate' => int, (only for voice channels)
  'userLimit' => int, (only for voice channels, 0 = unlimited)
  'slowmode' => int, (only for text channels)
  'permissionOverwrites' => \CharlotteDunois\Yasmin\Utils\Collection|array, (an array or Collection of PermissionOverwrite instances or permission overwrite arrays*)
  'parent' => \CharlotteDunois\Yasmin\Models\CategoryChannel|string, (string = channel ID)
  'nsfw' => bool (only for text channels)
)

  *  array(
  *      'id' => string, (an user/member or role ID)
  *      'type' => 'member'|'role',
  *      'allow' => \CharlotteDunois\Yasmin\Models\Permissions|int,
  *      'deny' => \CharlotteDunois\Yasmin\Models\Permissions|int
  *  )
```

send.name: send
send.short_desc: Executes the webhooks and sends a message to the channel. Resolves with an instance of Message, or a Collection of Message instances, mapped by their ID. Or when using the WebhookClient, it will resolve with a raw Message object (array) or an array of raw Message objects (array).
send.long_desc:
Options are as following (all are optional):

```
array(
   'embeds' => \CharlotteDunois\Yasmin\Models\MessageEmbed[]|array[], (an array of (embed) array/object or MessageEmbed instances)
   'files' => array, (an array of `[ 'name' => string, 'data' => string || 'path' => string ]` or just plain file contents, file paths or URLs)
   'nonce' => string, (a snowflake used for optimistic sending)
   'disableEveryone' => bool, (whether @everyone and @here should be replaced with plaintext, defaults to client option disableEveryone (which itself defaults to false))
   'tts' => bool,
   'split' => bool|array, (*)
   'username' => string,
   'avatar' => string, (an URL)
)

  * array(
  *   'before' => string, (The string to insert before the split)
  *   'after' => string, (The string to insert after the split)
  *   'char' => string, (The string to split on)
  *   'maxLength' => int, (The max. length of each message)
  * )
```

force.name: force
force.short_desc: Reset typing counter and stop sending the indicator.

typingCount.name: typingCount
typingCount.short_desc: Returns the amount of user typing in this channel.

CharlotteDunois\\Yasmin\\Utils\\Collecti.name: CharlotteDunois\Yasmin\Utils\Collection
CharlotteDunois\\Yasmin\\Utils\\Collecti.short_desc: Collection, an util to conventionally store a key-value pair.

__construct.name: __construct
__construct.short_desc: I think you are supposed to know what this does.

avg.name: avg
avg.short_desc: Gets the average of all items.

chunk.name: chunk
chunk.short_desc: Breaks the collection into multiple, smaller collections of a given size. Returns a new Collection.

collapse.name: collapse
collapse.short_desc: Collapses a collection of arrays into a flat collection. Returns a new Collection.

combine.name: combine
combine.short_desc: Combines the keys of the collection with the values of another array or collection. Returns a new Collection.

contains.name: contains
contains.short_desc: Determines whether the collection contains a given item.

count.name: count
count.short_desc: Returns the total number of items in the collection.

delete.name: delete
delete.short_desc: Removes an item from the collection by its key.

diff.name: diff
diff.short_desc: Compares the collection against another collection or a plain PHP array based on its value. Returns a new Collection.

diffKeys.name: diffKeys
diffKeys.short_desc: Compares the collection against another collection or a plain PHP array based on its key. Returns a new Collection.

each.name: each
each.short_desc: Iterates over the items in the collection and passes each item to a given callback. Returning `false` in the callback will stop the processing.

every.name: every
every.short_desc: Creates a new collection consisting of every n-th element.

except.name: except
except.short_desc: Returns all items in the collection except for those with the specified keys. Returns a new Collection.

filter.name: filter
filter.short_desc: Filters the collection by a given callback, keeping only those items that pass a given truth test. Returns a new Collection.

first.name: first
first.short_desc: Returns the first element in the collection that passes a given truth test.

flatten.name: flatten
flatten.short_desc: Flattens a multi-dimensional collection into a single dimension. Returns a new Collection.

flip.name: flip
flip.short_desc: Swaps the collection's keys with their corresponding values. Returns a new Collection.

get.name: get
get.short_desc: Returns the item for a given key. If the key does not exist, null is returned.

groupBy.name: groupBy
groupBy.short_desc: Groups the collection's items by a given key. Returns a new Collection.

has.name: has
has.short_desc: Determines if a given key exists in the collection.

implode.name: implode
implode.short_desc: Joins the items in a collection. Its arguments depend on the type of items in the collection. If the collection contains arrays or objects, you should pass the key of the attributes you wish to join, and the "glue" string you wish to place between the values.

indexOf.name: indexOf
indexOf.short_desc: Returns the position of the given value in the collection. Returns null if the given value couldn't be found.

intersect.name: intersect
intersect.short_desc: Removes any values that are not present in the given array or collection. Returns a new Collection.

keyBy.name: keyBy
keyBy.short_desc: Keys the collection by the given key.

keys.name: keys
keys.short_desc: Returns all of the collection's keys. Returns a new Collection.

last.name: last
last.short_desc: Returns the last element in the collection that passes a given truth test.

map.name: map
map.short_desc: Iterates through the collection and passes each value to the given callback. The callback is free to modify the item and return it, thus forming a new collection of modified items.

max.name: max
max.short_desc: Return the maximum value of a given key.

merge.name: merge
merge.short_desc: Merges the given array into the collection. Any string key in the array matching a string key in the collection will overwrite the value in the collection. Returns a new Collection.

min.name: min
min.short_desc: Return the minimum value of a given key.

only.name: only
only.short_desc: Returns the items in the collection with the specified keys. Returns a new Collection.

pluck.name: pluck
pluck.short_desc: Return the values from a single column in the input array. Returns a new Collection.

pop.name: pop
pop.short_desc: Removes and returns the last item from the collection.

pull.name: pull
pull.short_desc: Removes and returns an item from the collection by its key.

random.name: random
random.short_desc: Returns one random item, or multiple random items inside a Collection, from the Collection. Returns a new Collection.

reduce.name: reduce
reduce.short_desc: Reduces the collection to a single value, passing the result of each iteration into the subsequent iteration.

reverse.name: reverse
reverse.short_desc: Reverses the order of the collection's items. Returns a new Collection.

search.name: search
search.short_desc: Searches the collection for the given value and returns its key if found. If the item is not found, false is returned.

shift.name: shift
shift.short_desc: Removes and returns the first item from the collection.

shuffle.name: shuffle
shuffle.short_desc: Randomly shuffles the items in the collection. Returns a new Collection.

slice.name: slice
slice.short_desc: Returns a slice of the collection starting at the given index. Returns a new Collection.

sort.name: sort
sort.short_desc: Sorts the collection. Returns a new Collection.

sortBy.name: sortBy
sortBy.short_desc: Sorts the collection by the given key. Returns a new Collection.

sortByDesc.name: sortByDesc
sortByDesc.short_desc: Sorts the collection by the given key in descending order. Returns a new Collection.

splice.name: splice
splice.short_desc: Removes and returns a slice of items starting at the specified index. Returns a new Collection.

sum.name: sum
sum.short_desc: Returns the sum of all items in the collection.

take.name: take
take.short_desc: Returns a new collection with the specified number of items.

unique.name: unique
unique.short_desc: Returns all of the unique items in the collection. Returns a new Collection.

values.name: values
values.short_desc: Returns a new collection with the keys reset to consecutive integers.

cleanContent.name: cleanContent
cleanContent.short_desc: Cleans the text from mentions, by providing a context message.

escapeMarkdown.name: escapeMarkdown
escapeMarkdown.short_desc: Escapes any Discord-flavour markdown in a string.

onlyCodeBlock.name: onlyCodeBlock
onlyCodeBlock.short_desc: Whether to only escape codeblocks (takes priority).

onlyInlineCode.name: onlyInlineCode
onlyInlineCode.short_desc: Whether to only escape inline code.

getFilesystem.name: getFilesystem
getFilesystem.short_desc: Returns the stored React Filesystem instance, or null.

makeBase64URI.name: makeBase64URI
makeBase64URI.short_desc: Turns input into a base64-encoded data URI.

makeDateTime.name: makeDateTime
makeDateTime.short_desc: Makes a DateTime instance from an UNIX timestamp and applies the default timezone.

parseMentions.name: parseMentions
parseMentions.short_desc: Parses mentions in a text. Resolves with an array of `[ 'type' => string, 'ref' => Models ]` arrays, in the order they were parsed.
parseMentions.long_desc:
For mentions not available to this method or the client (e.g. mentioning a channel with no access to), `ref` will be the parsed mention (string).
Includes everyone and here mentions.

resolveColor.name: resolveColor
resolveColor.short_desc: Resolves a color to an integer.

resolveFileResolvable.name: resolveFileResolvable
resolveFileResolvable.short_desc: Resolves filepath and URL into file data - returns it if it's neither. Resolves with a string.

splitMessage.name: splitMessage
splitMessage.short_desc: Splits a string into multiple chunks at a designated character that do not exceed a specific length.
splitMessage.long_desc:
Options will be merged into default split options (see Message), so missing elements will get added.
```
array(
    'before' => string, (the string to add before the chunk)
    'after' => string, (the string to add after the chunk)
    'char' => string, (the string to split on)
    'maxLength' => int (the max. length of each chunk)
)
```

options.name: options
options.short_desc: Options controlling the behaviour of the split.

typecastVariable.name: typecastVariable
typecastVariable.short_desc: Typecasts the variable to the type, if not null.

waitForEvent.name: waitForEvent

Options may be:
```
array(

)
```
exceptions: The exception the promise gets rejected with, if waiting times out.
The exception the promise gets rejected with, if the promise gets cancelled.
